# The `AMDGPUPerfHintAnalysis.cpp` File Reference

<DoxygenPage pluginConfig={pluginConfig}>

Analyzes if a function potentially memory bound and if a kernel kernel may benefit from limiting number of waves to reduce cache thrashing. <a href="#details">More...</a>

## Description {#details}

Analyzes if a function potentially memory bound and if a kernel kernel may benefit from limiting number of waves to reduce cache thrashing.

<SectionDefinition>

<Link id="l00106" /><CodeLine lineNumber="106"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// The purpose is to identify memory access pattern like:</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00107" /><CodeLine lineNumber="107"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// x = a&#91;i&#93;;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00108" /><CodeLine lineNumber="108"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// y = a&#91;i+1000&#93;;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00109" /><CodeLine lineNumber="109"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// z = a&#91;i+2000&#93;;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00110" /><CodeLine lineNumber="110"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// In the above example, the second and third memory access will be marked</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00111" /><CodeLine lineNumber="111"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// large stride memory access.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
